transportAdvice: Kota Kinabalu's city centre is walkable for short distances, but the heat and humidity make longer walks uncomfortable; public minibuses and taxis cover most tourist areas, and metered or negotiated taxis are widely available for reaching attractions outside the centre.

weather.description: Warm and humid with occasional afternoon showers, generally pleasant for outdoor activities.
One of the drier and sunnier months, making it a good time for island trips and hiking.
Warm and relatively dry with good visibility, ideal for snorkelling and outdoor adventures.
Temperatures rise and humidity increases, with short afternoon thunderstorms becoming more frequent.
Warm and increasingly wet as the southwest monsoon approaches, with regular afternoon rain.
Southwest monsoon brings frequent rain, though mornings are often clear enough for activities.
Continued monsoon conditions with warm temperatures and regular showers throughout the day.
Similar to July, with overcast skies and intermittent rain but still manageable for sightseeing.
Rain remains frequent as the monsoon continues, with warm and muggy conditions.
One of the wetter months with heavy downpours possible, though breaks of sunshine still occur.
Northeast monsoon brings increased rainfall and rougher seas, limiting some island excursions.
Wet and humid with frequent heavy rain, though the festive atmosphere in the city remains lively.
